metadata.description: Fey are magical creatures closely tied to the forces of nature. They dwell in twilight groves and misty forests.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The pixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Superior Invisibility
actions.description: The pixie magically turns invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the pixie wears or carries is invisible with it.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 5 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

actions.name: Heart Sight
actions.description: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature's current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 10 Charisma saving throw, the sprite also knows the creature's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.description: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.description: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.description: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

actions.name: Club
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

actions.name: Fey Charm
actions.description:
The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.

The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Ram
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

creatures.name: Blink Dog
languages: understands Sylvan but can't speak it

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.description: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Teleport (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: The dog magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Before or after teleporting, the dog can make one bite attack.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.description: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.description:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

actions.name: Invisible Passage
actions.description: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Horrific Appearance
traits.description:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.description: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.description:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

creatures.name: Night Hag
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Claws (Hag Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.description: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.description: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a heartstone in her possession.

actions.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
actions.description: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

traits.name: Blurred Movement
traits.description: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless the quickling is incapacitated or restrained.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.description: If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The quickling makes three dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Iron Boots
traits.description: While moving, the redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Outsize Strength
traits.description: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The redcap makes three attacks with its wicked sickle.

actions.name: Wicked Sickle
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Ironbound Pursuit
actions.description: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

creatures.name: Yeth Hound
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.description: The yeth hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Sunlight Banishment
traits.description: If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, returning to the Material Plane at night or when the light is blocked.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.description: While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

actions.name: Baleful Baying
actions.description: The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

creatures.name: Korred
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Command Hair
traits.description: The korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven of its hair. As a bonus action, the korred commands one such rope within 30 feet to move up to 20 feet and entangle a Large or smaller creature that the korred can see. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled by the rope (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes incapacitated.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.description: The korred has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Stone Stride
traits.description: Once on each of its turns, the korred can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one stone object or surface and emerge from a second stone object or surface within 60 feet of the first.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The korred makes two attacks with its greatclub or hurls two rocks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.description: Any beast or humanoid that starts its turn within 10 feet of the meenlock must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.description: While in bright light, the meenlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5-6)
traits.description: As a bonus action, the meenlock can teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it, provided that both the space it's teleporting from and its destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination need not be within line of sight.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

creatures.name: Eladrin (Autumn)
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Enchanting Presence
traits.description:
Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Enchanting Presence for 24 hours.

Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
traits.description: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The eladrin makes two longsword attacks or makes one longsword attack and casts one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

reactions.name: Foster Peace
reactions.description: If a creature charmed by the eladrin hits with an attack roll while within 60 feet of the eladrin, the eladrin magically causes the attack to miss, provided the eladrin can see the attacker.

creatures.name: Annis Hag
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Iron Token
traits.description: The hag can spend 1 minute to create a small iron token, such as a key, ring, or coin. A creature holding this token can communicate telepathically with the hag while both are on the same plane. The hag can have up to three such tokens in existence at a time. As an action while a token is on her person, she can see and hear what that token's holder can see and hear, and the hag can speak through the token if she chooses. While perceiving through a token, the hag is deaf and blind with regard to her own senses. She can end this effect early as a free action, and a token is destroyed if she creates a fourth.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The annis hag makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Crushing Hug
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (9d6+5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 36 (9d6+5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hag's turns. The hag can't make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

3/day_each: disguise self (including the form of a Medium humanoid)

traits.name: Graystaff Magic
traits.description: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. While holding the staff, she can cast additional spells with it (see below). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.description: The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost her extra movement.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8+1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Maddening Feast
actions.description: The hag feasts on the corpse of one enemy within reach that died within the past minute. Each creature of the hag's choice that is within 60 feet of her and able to see her must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature is incapacitated, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Maddening Feast for the next 24 hours.

creatures.name: Eladrin (Spring)
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Joyful Presence
traits.description: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Joyful Presence for 24 hours.

traits.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
traits.description: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When it uses this ability, it can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of it. That creature then teleports instead, appearing in an unoccupied space of the eladrin's choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The eladrin makes two longsword attacks or makes one longsword attack and casts one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10+4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage.

creatures.name: Eladrin (Summer)
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Fearsome Presence
traits.description: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the eladrin for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for 24 hours.

traits.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
traits.description: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Immediately after it teleports, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) fire damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The eladrin makes two longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10+4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8+5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The eladrin adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the eladrin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

creatures.name: Eladrin (Winter)
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Sorrowful Presence
traits.description: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has its speed reduced to 0 and is incapacitated. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for 24 hours.

traits.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
traits.description: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When it uses this ability, one creature the eladrin can see within 5 feet of it before it teleports must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the eladrin until the end of the eladrin's next turn.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The eladrin makes two longsword attacks or makes one longsword attack and casts one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

reactions.name: Frigid Rebuke
reactions.description: When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can force that creature to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 11 (2d10) cold damage.

traits.name: Death Flash
traits.description: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area and able to see the bright light must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.description: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage. If the darkling has advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.
